MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001310
Special Investigation Intake Date: April 4, 2024
License #: CB610201023
Licensee Group Organization: Catholic Charities West Michigan
Licensee Designee: JILL SCHREUDER
Chief Administrator: JILL SCHREUDER
Agency Name: CATHOLIC CHARITIES WEST MICHIGAN -
MUSKEGON
Agency Address: 1720 PARK ST
MUSKEGON, MI 49441-2403
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 07/30/2025
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Contact Purpose
Method
4/8/2024 1:45 PM Phone Special Investigation Initiation
6/3/2024 3:30 PM Phone Interview
6/4/2024 9:30 AM Phone Interview
6/27/2024 2:00 PM Phone Interview
6/27/2024 2:15 PM Phone Interview
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Visitation and family time; in person contact
Title
1

Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12421
Section • (2) An agency social service worker shall visit the foster
Description child, and the foster parent, if applicable, in the child's
placement at least once every month.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster parents denied home visit was completed in February, yet
a home visit was documented 2/27/24.
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant on 4/8/2024. Complainant said Foster
Parent reported Foster Care Worker, assigned to Youth A had not
completed a foster home visit in February 2024. Complainant
reported when Complainant accessed the information system for
Youth A, a foster home visit was documented for 2/27/24.
Complainant stated she subsequently contacted the agency
regarding this documentation. Complainant stated the entry was
subsequently deleted in the case record.
I interviewed Foster Care Supervisor on 6/3/2024 regarding the
documentation issue. Foster Care Supervisor stated the 2/27/24
date was when supervision was completed with Foster Care
Worker. Foster Care Supervisor stated the Foster Care Worker
had entered a "placeholder" date in the record and the date of the
completed home visit for February occurred on 2/7/24. Foster
Care Supervisor stated Foster Care Worker had additional visits to
the foster home of Youth A in February when transporting Youth A
for parenting time on February 2, 12, and 26.
I interviewed the Foster Parent by phone on 6/4/2024. Foster
Parent confirmed Foster Care Worker had been to the home
different times in February during the transportation of Youth A for
parenting time but denied a foster home visit had occurred in
February.
I interviewed Chief Administrator by phone on 6/27/2024. Chief
Administrator indicated the workers at one time did have a
“placeholder” system for entry/documentation purposes, but the
agency is in the process of discontinuing that practice. It was not
a formal written policy/procedure.
I interviewed Foster Care Worker by phone on 6/27/2024. Foster
Care Worker stated she had completed the foster home visit
documented on 2/7/2024. Foster Care Worker indicated the
2

2/7/2024 visit included transporting Youth A for a parenting visit,
but Foster Care Worker was also in the home to observe/complete
the foster home visit requirements. Foster Care Worker stated
there were also additional times when she was in the home as a
part of completing her case management responsibilities.
Documents Reviewed:
MiSACWIS case file review: A review of the case record for Youth
A indicated a foster home visit by Foster Care Worker was
completed on 2/7/2024 and entered into MiSACWIS on 4/4/24.
Youth A was observed to be doing well in this foster home
placement. The verification of well-being contact was as follows:
“Caseworker met with Youth A during an announced foster home
visit. Due to his age, Youth A is unable to communicate regarding
placement, behavior management or his time in care. Youth A
continues to sleep in a crib where safe sleep continues to be
followed. Youth A continues to engage in Early On appointments
on a bi-weekly basis. Upon walkthrough of the home, it appears
appropriate with no safety concerns. Foster parents continue to
report that Youth A is eating well but does not sleep through the
night. Youth A continues to exhibit a strong bond with his foster
mom as he seeks comfort from her. Youth A is up to date on his
well child exams. Foster parents have not reported any concerns
following Youth A's return from his supervised parenting time
visits. Foster parents report utilizing supervision for behavior
management due to Youth A's age. Youth A is able to sit
independently and is able to hold his bottle”.
The social work contacts for February 2024 and the updated
service plan for the time period 1/30/2024-4/26/2024, approved
4/26/2024, were reviewed as a part of this special investigation.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as there isn’t enough
information to say otherwise. Foster Care Worker stated she
visited the home on 2/7/24 and documented the visit two months
later on the date of the complaint. The Foster Parent reported a
home visit didn’t occur.
Technical Assistance:
Technical assistance was provided to the agency as a part of this
investigation to modify the agency's documentation procedures
within the information system and no longer utilize the use of
"placeholders", and only enter the information for social work
contacts upon their completion.
3

Consultation
Consultation was offered to remind staff that face-to-face required
social work contacts are to be entered into the system in a timely
manner. MDHHS policy requires they be entered within 5 days.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
7/1/2024
______________________________________
Mark Hunter Date
